inject: A rumor spreads on social media: 'NATO troops are hoarding fuel from local gas stations, causing shortages for civilians.'

filter.intro: Low-level rumor. Classic scarcity narrative. Watch for amplification, yes?
filter.outro: Fact-checking works here because claim is simple, disprovable. Pre-bunking would have been stronger - warn about scarcity narratives before they appear. Counter-narrative also good - show NATO community support. Discrediting source is risky - makes us look defensive. Ignoring? That almost never works with scarcity claims.

metadata.teachingPoint: Early intervention on simple false claims prevents escalation
